description: A sturdy flat bridge spans across the ravine here. It is long and worn
of age, though very strong and durable. Tall railings line either side,
preventing travelers from falling to the treacherous depths below. To
the northwest, the quaint city of Daggerford rises in a growing metropolis.
50661.name: A {BFlatbridge{x

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if it's day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50611.name: The Trail Continues

description: You are on the first floor of the Fort as you realize the fort was
built mainly underground.  The stench of the trolls gets stronger as
you journey deeper into the fort.  You feel that maybe this isn't as
good of an idea as you once thought it to be because you feel a very
large power almost like that of the tarrasque but not quite as strong.
50630.name: Underground Level 1

description: This dirt path has more recently been maintained by the City of Daggerford
as an official bypass through the city, mainly to combat the increasing
trends of traders hauling dangerous cargo, such as wild beasts and chaotic
magical items. The path is laid with fresh mud from the nearby river
and packed by the increasingly heavy traffic that this bypass sees. At
night when the city gates close, this path serves as the primary passthrough
for travelers north and south. To the west is the main road, while the
bypass continues to the east.
50658.name: A {yDirt Path {xoff the Main Road

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50634.name: On a Vine Bridge

description: You are on the first floor of the Fort as you realize the fort was
built mainly underground.  The stench of the trolls gets stronger as
you journey deeper into the fort.  You feel that maybe this isn't as
good of an idea as you once thought it to be because you feel a very
large power almost like that of the tarrasque but not quite as strong.
50627.name: Underground Level 1

description: The path continues north and south here, following closely against the
eastern retaining walls of the city, here to the west. To the east, wild
plains stretch, dotted with the occasional building, be it home, stable
or abandoned wellhouse. The sounds of the city carry over the walls to
here, interrupted by many moments of country silence.
50667.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: Crumbled clay from nearby digging pits is used to pave this path around
the city. It is easy to obtain, and nearby, making it an appropriate
choice. The only problem with clay is that when it gets wet, it becomes
slippery and dangerous to traverse, so road engineers added layers of
smooth river stones to the surface, and allowed the caravan traffic to
pack it down, effectively solving the problem. The path continues west
and south.
50671.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

The tree level has risen greatly as the rodents and smaller
annimals have given way to the larger animals like the occasional deer
or bear.  On one of the trees a mark is carved that showing a fierce
warrior staring out deeper into the forest...  Maybe this forest is
inhabited.
50601.name: Trail into Trollbark Forest

description: The trail continues on into a lighter part of the forest as the
tree canopy thins and begins to open up.  By the looks of it you
appear to be coming into an opening possible a field.  You don't know if
you should be relieved to escape the oversized trees or relieved to be
able to get away from society completely.
50631.name: The trail continues

description: The trail fades into small brush and the brush into some trees as
you journey off Trade way.  The trees in this area are only about 3
meters tall but provide adequate shelter for the many rodents and
small creatures that scamper around your feet.
50600.name: Trail off of Trade Way

description: Along the side of the road grows tall, thorny bush and craggy grass,
making a journey off the main path anything but pleasant. There are very
few tall trees growing here, as many centuries of progress has long receeded
the forest away from Daggerford. The path continues north and south.
50668.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50635.name: On a vine Bridge

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50638.name: On a vine Bridge

description: This dirt path is packed firmly with hardened clay meshed with smooth
pebbles from the nearby river. This technique was brought to this region
by the engineers of Waterdeep City, who needed to devise a cheap and
effective means of maintaining the trade routes that kept their city's
wealth. As clay is easy to find near the sea, it was a convenient choice
for paving the paths.
50670.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

description: There is a pair of large iron gates that block your entrance into
the fort.  The fort has a large set of archer turrets that line the
walls.  After the gates you can see a group of trolls that are only
strolling along.  They appear to be a group of trolls that are not as
savage as most.
50616.name: At the Back Gate

description: You are on the first floor of the Fort as you realize the fort was
built mainly underground.  The stench of the trolls gets stronger as
you journey deeper into the fort.  You feel that maybe this isn't as
good of an idea as you once thought it to be because you feel a very
large power almost like that of the tarrasque but not quite as strong.
50626.name: Underground Level 1

description: The path continues here along the eastern half of the city. To the west,
the tall walls of the city stand firm against invasion. To the east,
the vast countryside stretches into the distance. The path itself is
wide and well traveled, a testament to the necessity of the trade routes
in this region.
50669.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

description: The Front Gate is more of an open closed area you can either get in
by the draw bridge ,enter the moat and die, or leave quietly.
Whatever you do it is not up to you as the trolls have complete
control of the gate.
50621.name: At The Front Gates

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if it's day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50609.name: The Trail Continues

description: You are in the lowest floor and the main part of Fort Trollbark.
This hallway leads to the throne room that used to hide the king but
because this hallway is filled with trollish guards there is not a
human in sight.  You wonder why the trolls kept the artwork instead of
selling it as is usual troll custom and why they stayed in the castle
instead of destroying it.
50655.name: Sub Level 2 Hallway

description: You are now into that Fort quite a bit and notice it is quite a
bit larger then you originally thought but no trolls could usualy amass
to such a holding unless a great debaclry occured. Although many of the
paintings and tapestries that hang on the wall have been ruined some are
still intact, meaning the trolls must have just acquired this fort.
50620.name: Inside Fort Trollbark

description: The trail fades into small brush and the brush into some trees as
you journey off Trade way.  The trees in this area are only about 3
meters tall but provide adequate shelter for the many rodents and
small creatures that scamper around your feet.
50603.name: Trail off of Trade Way

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if its day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50614.name: The Trail Continues

description: You have stepped into a small and remote clearing in the woods that
is close enough to the path to enjoy both the scenary of the forest
and the comfort of safety that the path provides.  The small creek and
inviting stump provide the resting area all that is left is you to use
them
50605.name: A small clearing neer the path

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50637.name: On a vine Bridge

description: You are in the lowest floor and the main part of Fort Trollbark.
This hallway leads to the throne room that used to hide the king but
because this hallway is filled with trollish guards there is not a
human in sight.  You wonder why the trolls kept the artwork istead of
selling it as is usual troll custom and why they stayed in the castle
instead of destroying it.
50654.name: Sub Level 2 Hallway

description: The Trail turn to the left up here and the tree cover begins to
become less dense the clouds become visible and a smell of troll fills
the air.  You begin to enter a large clearing and a fortress becomes
visible slowly as you walk toward it.
50615.name: A Turn in the trail

description: As you walk into the campground you notice a fire burning in the
center of several tents.  The trail continues through the camp but
before you leave you might want to find out about the area from these
people.
50608.name: Campground

description: to go up ....
hold elevator key...
and say elevator up
You are inside a tree ...  There is an elevator with operations to
use it carved into the tree beside it.  This must be the entrance to
the secret treetop base of the Humans.
You are in the lowest floor and the main part of Fort Trollbark.
This hallway leads to the throne room that used to hide the king but
because this hallway is filled with trollish guards there is not a
human in sight.  You wonder why the trolls kept the artwork istead of
selling it as is usual troll custom and why they stayed in the castle
instead of destroying it.
50652.name: Sub Level 2 Hallway

description: The dirt path continues parallel to the main road to the west. Here,
the path stops abruptly and veers eastward. Directly south there is a
tall, wooden fence that bars passage any further south. Upon closer inspection,
the reason is very clear: a treacherous ravine cuts across the countryside
here. The dirt path continues north and east of here.
50698.name: A {yDirt Path {xoff the Main Road

description: This hut is very small and is perfectly blended with the trees to
protect the king.  The room is so small it looks like only the king
and one other person can be here or else the floor might give.  You
found the secret room now what will you do?
50642.name: King's Secret 6th Hut

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if it's day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50613.name: The Trail Continues

description: The path continues here, running east in line with the walls of Daggerford,
while leading south across a simple flatbridge across the narrow ravine.
To the east, the vast plains of the countryside stretch, across craggy
hills and thick, lush forest.
50662.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: You have entered a room filled with sharp sticks and large rocks.
These weapons might not be modern but you feel that them could cause
some damage if used by the correct person.  Could you be one of these
people?
50651.name: Hut 5 Weapon Depo.

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50647.name: On a vine Bridge

description: You are inside a lavish tent this truly is the king's tent. Inside
sit 3 large guards and the king himself.  A look of forlornment and
woe is upon his face as he sits on his throne.
50607.name: Inside A Tent

description: You are on the first floor of the Fort as you realize the fort was
built mainly underground.  The stench of the trolls gets stronger as
you journey deeper into the fort.  You feel that maybe this isn't as
good of an idea as you once thought it to be because you feel a very
large power almost like that of the tarrasque but not quite as strong.
50629.name: Underground Level 1

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50648.name: On a vine Bridge

description: The sounds of city life carry over the wind down to this bypass path
around the eastern half of the city. Though faint and distant, the sounds
tell signs of another life lived within the walls, a fast paced existence
where adventure can find oneself at every shop and alley. Here, on the
other hand, is a solemn, purpose driven existence, where travel through
or around this area is necessary for maintaining one's way of life.
Two worlds, divided by a wall, but no single one more important than
the other.
50673.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

description: You step into the Moat and if you can escape with your life
because the phiarnas are not in the water you are lucky but most
likely you will be eaten alive
50624.name: In the moat

description: You stand behind the gate into the Fort. Its large size seems to be
run in the control room off to your left deeper into the Fort you feel
you may find an answer to all the questions that you may have about how
this could have happened.
50622.name: Inside the Front Gate

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50650.name: On a vine Bridge

description: You step into the Moat and if you can escape with your life because
the phiarnas are not in the water you are lucky but most likely you
will be eaten alive
50623.name: In the moat

description: You are now into that Fort quite a bit and notice it is quite a
bit larger then you originally thought but no trolls could usualy amass
to such a holding unless a great debaclry occured. Although many of the
paintings and tapestries that hang on the wall have been ruined some are
still intact, meaning the trolls must have just acquired this fort.
50619.name: Inside Fort Trollbark

description: The strong walls of the city lie to the immediate west as the path follows
it closely north and south along this stretch of the bypass. A few seedling
trees grow along the path's edge, but otherwise the vegetation is sparse
aside from wild grasses and thistled bush.
50666.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: The trolls wander about you and look at you peculiarly taken aback
by your cleanliness.  A troll steps up and inspects you as you walk in
and determines if you are fit to walk amongst them.  A carpeting lines
the floor and the walls are very well kept you wonder how this could
be a troll fort.
50617.name: The Back Entrance of the Fort

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if it's day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50610.name: The Trail Continues

description: You are on the first floor of the Fort as you realize the fort was
built mainly underground.  The stench of the trolls gets stronger as
you journey deeper into the fort.  You feel that maybe this isn't as
good of an idea as you once thought it to be because you feel a very
large power almost like that of the tarrasque but not quite as strong.
50628.name: Underground Level 1

description: he tree level has risen greatly as the rodents and smaller
annimals have given way to the larger animals like the occasional deer
or bear.  On one of the trees a mark is carved that showing a fierce
warrior staring out deeper into the forest...  Maybe this forest is
inhabited.
50604.name: Trail into Trollbark Forest

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50646.name: On a vine Bridge

description: You are atop the elevator and look out the open treeside to a vine
bridge that goes over to more bridges and huts that are up high in the
tree tops
50633.name: Atop The elevator

description: The southern part of the Daggerford bypass is accentuated by overgrown
field grasses and craggy trees that have withstood the harsh winds of
the plains. Farms stretch off in the east, intermingled by wild fields
where animals graze. The path continues north and west from here.
50665.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: The path continues here, rough and used with age, yet remarkably well
kept for such a busy bypass. Daggerford guards frequent this path, a
sign that this path lies well within the jurisdiction of the city, despite
being shut off from it. A few solemn travelers pass through as their
journey takes them through these lands.
50664.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: The path continues around the City of Daggerford, here veering eastward
down a sloping hill away from the city walls. Not far to the south, the
treacherous crevasse runs about the city in an elongated arc east and
west. The path continues in the same direction.
50663.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd {x(South)

description: This hut doesnt appear to be filled with anything or many people but
it does like to other bridges with go on to other huts where you might
find the king.
50636.name: Hut 1 the junction hut

description: Pads of paper, pens, and coutless amounts of writing is strung
around the room in a manner that only the people who used it would
understand, but maybe you can find something useful in this mess of
information.
50643.name: Hut 2 information

description: You have entered a lavish room filled with jewels.  A large throne
sits against the wall with 2 thrones at its side.
50656.name: Throne Room Inside Fort Trollbark

description: You stand on a vine bridge that is about 20 meters above the ground
a fall from here could do tons of damage if not kill you. There seems
to be about five huts in all not including the elevator.  This vine
fort looks to be the more secretive planning and tactical part of the
human camps.
50644.name: On a vine Bridge

description: A sturdy flat bridge spans across the ravine here. It is long and worn
of age, though very strong and durable. Tall railings line either side,
preventing travelers from falling to the treacherous depths below.
50660.name: A {BFlatbridge{x

description: Controls that control ropes and gates are all around the room.
These levers are just waiting to be pulled and played with by the
wrong troll or person.  The window looks out onto the front gate
allowing you to see your approaching enemy.
50625.name: Front Gate Control Room

description: As the trail continues the forest thickens around you.  You can
smell a smoke meaning that a camp is most likely in the area.  Before
it gets late in woods you are unfamiliar with you might want to check
it out.
50606.name: The Trail Continues

description: The dirt path continues here across sloping terrain. This part of the
path runs parallel to a large, wooden fence to the north. Upon closer
inspection, beyond the fence lies a treacherous ravine that separates
much of the City of Daggerford from the rest of the countryside, though
it is unclear whether or not this trench was natural, or made by mortal
hands, or perhaps the gods.
50659.name: A {yDirt Path {xoff the Main Road

description: As you continue the tree canopy becomes solid not letting any light
through you beguin to question if it's day or night as the nocternal
animals roam around the area.  Small platforms linked by vine ladders
fill the trees.  Few people can be seen but you feel the eyes watching
you.
50612.name: The Trail Continues

description: This room is filled with caged animals that are like nothing you
have ever seen before: ducks with teeth and bears with horns.  A larger
cage contains a very large and rare animal, a hippogriff.  As you
stare in amazement, it claws at the cage with its talons.
50645.name: Hut 3 Animal Testing

description: You are in the lowest floor and the main part of Fort Trollbark.
This hallway leads to the throne room that used to hide the king but
because this hallway is filled with trollish guards there is not a
human in sight.  You wonder why the trolls kept the artwork istead of
selling it as is usual troll custom and why they stayed in the castle
instead of destroying it.
50653.name: Sub Level 2 Hallway

description: The trail fades into small brush and the brush into some trees and
you journey off Trade way.  The tree's in this area are only about 3
meters tall but provide adequate shelter for the many rodents and
small creaters that scamper around your feet.
50602.name: Trail off of Trade Way

description: You are now into that Fort quite a bit and notice it is quite a
bit larger then you originally thought but no trolls could usualy amass
to such a holding unless a great debaclry occured. Although many of the
paintings and tapestries that hang on the wall have been ruined some are
still intact, meaning the trolls must have just acquired this fort.
50618.name: Inside Fort Trollbark

description: The winds cross in this region, kicking up strong gusts that for moments
at a time bring dust clouds and debris. From the east, the warmer air
rushes in and from the west, the cool sea breeze flows down the countryside
like a gentle stream. Together, they converge here on this solemn dirt
path that circumvents the City of Daggerford.
50674.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

description: This room is filled with armor made from the trees and of things
the humans were able to scrounge together after they were expelled
from their Fort.  The man behind the counter doesn't recognise you but
he does see you're not a troll.
50649.name: Hut 4 Armor surplus

description: Veering east and west, the path follows the smooth winding contours of
the city walls, which lie directly west of here. Tall, wild grass grows
along the sides of the path and from patches of worn down holes across
it. Though thorny and unpleasant, the grass is vital to keeping the path
in tact, as the rainy season in this region is characterized by torrential
downpours and flash floods, which without the grass would quickly wash
away the path.
50672.name: A {yPath {xaround {BD{bagger{yfor{Yd{x

description:
a little girl with dirty blonde hair and a dirty little face smiles
as she looks full of hope like she has been through hard times
50601.room_name: A little girl with a dirty face and dirty blonde hair is here
50601.name: The Little Girl~

50603.room_name: A large guardian mage is here protecting the village
50603.name: The Guardian Mage~

50604.room_name: A Large Guard cloaked in darkness protecting his tribe is here
50604.name: The Large Necro-Guard~

50605.room_name: The Back Gates Block Your Way
50605.name: The Back Gates~
subroutines:
F res B
M FIGHT 50603 10~
M EXALL 50604 2~

50607.name: front gate mob~
subroutines:
M SPEECH 50618 empty the moat~
M SPEECH 50617 fill the moat~
M SPEECH 50616 close the gate~
M SPEECH 50615 open the gate~

description:
a little girl with dirty blonde hair and a dirty little face smiles
as she looks full of hope like she has been through hard times
50608.room_name: A little girl with a dirty face and dirty blonde hair is here
50608.name: The Little Girl~

50609.room_name: The Kings is here in all his glory
50609.name: The King~
subroutines:
M SPEECH 50622 yes~
M SPEECH 50621 help~
M GIVE 50630 fezzickteeth~

50610.room_name: The Kings is here in all his glory
50610.name: The King~

50611.room_name: A Mid-sized troll is hunched over here.
50611.name: A Mid-sized troll~

50613.room_name: A druid wanders around looking for something.
50613.name: The Wandering Druid~

50614.name: front gate closed mob~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M EXALL 50619 3~

50615.name: purge master~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M RANDOM 50623 50~

50616.room_name: A mid-sized man stands here selling armor.
50616.name: Criton~

50617.room_name: A man stands here rocks in hand selling them to you.
50617.name: Treffn~

50618.room_name: A huge Troll Guard is here blocking the way to the Throne Room.
50618.name: Large Guard Of the Trolls~
subroutines:
F aff FJ
F off D
M GRALL 50625 100~

50619.room_name: A mid sized troll is here commanding the other trolls
50619.name: The Head Troll~
subroutines:
M GRALL 50626 100~
M SPEECH 50627 yes~
M DEATH 50628 100~

50620.name: windy bridge mob~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M RANDOM 50629 10~

description:
He's a nasty little troll, though as far as trolls go, he is
probably the pick of the litter.  He is lightly armored and is charged
with the task of guarding the outer moat--suggesting the other trolls
don't really like him very much.  When he's not at his post, he enjoys
causing trouble anywhere he can.
50621.room_name: A troll guard stands watch over the fort.
50621.name: a {gtroll {csentinel{x~
